  • Method Details

    • processForgotPassword

      @PostMapping("/forgot_password") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> processForgotPassword(@RequestBody LoginRequest request)
      The processForgotPassword function is used to send a reset password link to the user's email. it generates a jwt token add it to link and call send email function.
      Returns:
      A responseentity<string> object

    • sendEmail

      public void sendEmail(String recipientEmail, String link) throws jakarta.mail.MessagingException, UnsupportedEncodingException, SocketException
      The sendEmail function sends an email to the user with a link to reset their password. set sender, object, receiver and message and send it via mailSEnder(libero smtp).
      Parameters:
      String - recipientEmail Set the recipient of the email
      String - link Create the link to reset the password
      Throws:
      jakarta.mail.MessagingException
      UnsupportedEncodingException
      SocketException

    • verifytoken

      @PostMapping("/test_p") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> verifytoken(@RequestBody LoginRequest request) throws UserNotFoundException
      The verifytoken function is used to verify the token sent by the user.
      Returns:
      A string, but i need to return a loginrequest object
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException

    • processResetPassword

      @PostMapping("/reset_password") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> processResetPassword(@RequestBody LoginRequest request) throws UserNotFoundException
      The processResetPassword function is used to reset the password of a user. It takes in a LoginRequest object, which contains the token and new password for the user. The function checks if there is an existing token that matches with one stored in our database, and if it exists, then we update their password with their new one.
      Returns:
      A responseentity of type string
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException
